what.lead: Manage refugee flows from outside the EU,
what.text: by setting up a Unified EU Refugee System. The Dublin System must be reformed and complemented by a settlement scheme which provides for penalties and sanctions against States refusing to fulfil their responsibility.

what.lead: Make the asylum system fair, effective and quick,
what.text: by issuing EU guidelines that ensure shorter asylum procedures and provide for social, legal and psychological support.

what.lead: Ensure successful integration and a benefit for the economy.
what.text: Asylum seekers must be able to enter the job market from day one, and their skills must be more easily recognised. In addition, language training must be offered to all asylum seekers.

what.lead: Uphold asylum seekers’ and refugees’ rights,
what.text: by monitoring and sanctioning Member States who breach these rights, e.g., by detaining asylum seekers when unnecessary and under inhumane conditions.
by classifying famine and climate migrants as refugees under European law and by strengthening the use of humanitarian corridors
